etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 謷(謷) (áo) = phonetic indicator and meaning of sound -> exclamation 'oh'
etymology.interpretation: The character 噢(噢) combines 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to indicate sound or speaking, with 謷(謷) (áo) serving as the phonetic component. This combination captures the essence of the character as an exclamatory sound, typical for expressing surprise or realization.

examples.chinese: 噢(噢)，我忘记带钥匙了(我忘記帶鑰匙了)。
examples.pinyin: Ō, wǒ wàngjì dài yàoshi le.
examples.english: Oh, I forgot to bring the keys.

examples.chinese: 噢(噢)，这真是个好主意(這真是個好主意)。
examples.pinyin: Ō, zhè zhēn shì ge hǎo zhǔyì.
examples.english: Oh, that's really a good idea.
